title: Orbit Camera for Asset Preview

criteria.text: OrbitCamera struct exists with position, target, up fields
criteria.notes: OrbitCamera struct with spherical coords (azimuth, elevation, distance, target) in orbit_camera.rs

criteria.text: View and projection matrices computed correctly
criteria.notes: view_matrix() uses glam::Mat4::look_at_rh, projection_matrix() uses Mat4::perspective_rh

criteria.text: Pitch is clamped to prevent gimbal lock
criteria.notes: Elevation clamped to [-89, 89] degrees in handle_mouse_move

criteria.text: Zoom is clamped to min/max range
criteria.notes: Distance clamped to [0.5, 50.0] in handle_scroll with multiplicative zoom

checklist.item: Create OrbitCamera struct with orbit parameters
Add pitch clamping to prevent gimbal lock
Add zoom clamping to min/max range

worker_notes: Implemented OrbitCamera with glam for matrix math. Middle mouse orbits (azimuth/elevation), right mouse pans (target offset in camera-local coords), scroll zooms multiplicatively. Camera integrated into AssetEditor struct and battle_editor.rs event loop. uses_orbit_camera() gates camera for stages 2-5 only. All 16 unit tests pass. Both battle_editor and battle_arena compile cleanly.
learnings: glam::Mat4::look_at_rh and perspective_rh provide correct wgpu-compatible matrices (RH with [0,1] depth)
Multiplicative zoom (distance *= 1.0 - delta * factor) feels more natural than additive zoom
Pan sensitivity should scale with distance for consistent feel at all zoom levels
